quest.name: Above the Churning Waters
objectives: Wait for Lyse at Nyunkrepf's Hope.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Conrad confided in me that he was considering naming her as his successor, so it didn't come as a complete shock. I mean, I was still surprised, but I've never once doubted his judgment. None of us have. If he thought Lyse was the best choice, then she is.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (When did Lyse become leader of the Resistance? That...that is... Hm. I suppose we have Hien to thank for this too.)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I understand M'naago's concern. If they were to lose another leader so soon after losing Conrad, the Resistance might never recover.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: (More than a keeper, she needs a friend now. Stay close to her.)

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: One can but wonder how the rank and file of the XIIth Legion will view their leadership upon hearing about the fate of Specula Imperatoris.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Grim though it is, the conjurers have had no choice but to impose a rigid triage system when treating the wounded. Under the circumstances, we have to be realistic.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: Mark my words: when this is over, I will take the heads of every officer in Castrum Abania. I'll swing the bloody axe myself if I have to!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I still can't believe it. Conrad, and so many others, dead. It's not right, what those bastards did... It's not right.

dialogue.name: VMAHTIA
dialogue.text: You wouldn't believe the two fools we caught skulking about in imperial uniforms. It felt good handing them over to the Alliance...though it all feels pointless now.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Conrad always treated us with kindness and respect. His death will not go unavenged.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If you don't mind, I'd rather not wait around and have people try to talk me out of it. Let's get moving. I know a good vantage point overlooking the castrum.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Nyunkrepf's Hope─the ship stranded on the rocks to the east of here. It shouldn't take us long to get there. Oh, but there might be some ancient golems guarding it. Or that might just be an old wives' tale. Either way, it's worth the risk.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Lyse...Commander...I pray you proceed with all due caution. Do not hesitate to call upon us if needed.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: To reach the ship, we'll have to scale the cliff face. I'll get some climbing gear and meet you there, all right?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: The ship dates back to days of the great flood. The legend goes that it was teleported onto the rocks by magick. No idea if it's true, but I'll be damned if I know how else it could've got up there.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Sorry to keep you waiting! I see you've met the golems. Looks like the old stories were true, eh? In a way, I'm glad...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Right, then. Time to climb!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Whew! That took a bit more out of me than I expected...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: And here she is. Nyunkrepf's Hope. The ark that one man made to save countless others from the flood during the Sixth Umbral Era.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's comforting to think that there have always been people who cared this much about their fellow man─who accomplished such great feats that people couldn't help thinking they must be made up. But the proof's right here, isn't it?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I don't just mean the ship, you know. I mean you. Long before anyone started calling you a hero, you were there for those in need. You did things for people when you didn't have to─sometimes even when they didn't want you to.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It can't have been easy, staying true to yourself. But we're all better for it. Me included.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'll never be a leader like Conrad. Or Hien. Or my father...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But I can be a friend to you all, and I can fight by your side.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I can be me...and that'll just have to be enough, eh?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Strange to think back on it. If we'd been standing in different places, or if the shell had struck the tower differently, it would've been me instead of Conrad. Or maybe both of us.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What kind of monster murders their own...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Uh... Is that smoke from Castrum Abania? Wait─it's coming from the cannon!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I can't tell what happened from here, but I can tell that it won't be giving us any trouble in the immediate future.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: This is our chance, Forename─to avenge Conrad and all the others who died in the tower, friend and foe.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: To take Castrum Abania and bring the bastards who gave the order to fire to justice!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It won't be easy after the losses we took, but I know everyone's champing at the bit to strike back. With the right plan, I'm certain we can do it!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We have to tell the others! Come on!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Easier down than up, eh? Though not necessarily safer...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Anyway, no time to rest! We need to convince the others to strike now, before the imperials have time to fix their cannon.

obj.n: For the Living and the Dead
